other_notes: Physician Note (2025-09-29 10:15): LATE ENTRY Note Text : Assessed on medical rounds. On September 28th resident demonstrated some physical aggression towards coresident and toward staff according to progress notes. DOS reviewed, not fully complete, and expressions of physical risk on September 28th not captured. She continues on Lorazepam 5 mg po daily and Risperidone was discontinued. Today she appeared calm, ambulatory, and in no distress. Due to some ongoing BPSD with agitation/aggression, Olanzapine will be increased to 7.5 mg po daily. Continue to follow. Abdominal U/S results reviewed. Mass at right liver lobe measuring 5 x 3.5 x 3.6 cm noted, showing an increase size from 2.8 cm. Nodular structure also noted in the region of the head of the pancreas, possibly pancreatic enlargement. Plan to review these results with POA, along with overall discussion of goals of care. Resource nurse to schedule meeting. Dictated by Dr. Lee Andersen dictated but not read [e-SIGNED]

other_notes: Physician Note (2025-09-24 10:07): LATE ENTRY Note Text : Assessed on medical rounds. It is noted that resident had an episode on September 19 described as a "blank stare" for about one minute which occurred after he had been standing and banging his wheelchair. Decreased tone in the limbs was noted, and resident appeared pale at the time. On September 22nd, at approximately 1100 hours resident sustained a fall with no apparent injuries and BP after the incident was noted to be 72/45. He was monitored on head injury routine. Resident does have a known diagnosis of orthostatic hypotension, and receives Midodrine in the morning. Yesterday September 23rd in the evening resident sustained a fall in his room with a scalp laceration. He became agitated when staff attempted to assess VS, and chased staff out of his room, through the corridor and in to the common area. He was not clothed at the time. When given space, resident calmed down and returned to his room. Today, in conversation, resident has a clear memory of these events. He does not remember the circumstances of his fall, but think that he had been sleeping. He describes waking from a deep sleep, finding several Page 1 of 5 Note
